defaultPosition.description: IT Portfolio Manager overseeing implementation of large and complex programs with an annual spend of $40M.  Portfolio includes applications offered as a service (SaaS) to other DHS components.  Responsible for all financial, contractual, technical, and stakeholder management.  Manage team of 11 federal ITPMs/DBAs supporting 8 IT investments with 25 software applications (COTS, GOTS and custom).  Regularly conduct stakeholder outreach, facilitation, consensus building and provide briefings of program statuses to various levels of management including Executive Steering Committees.  Present risk mitigation plans to the ICE Chief Information Security Officer (CISO) for software applications in portfolio including POA&M (Plan of Action & Milestone) remediation planning.  Weekly support interaction with Information System Security Owners (ISSOs) for application security audits for financial systems (A-123, KPMG yearly audit) from IT perspective.  Closed audit findings for Criminal Alien Identification Initiatives (CAII)/Alien Criminal Response Information Management System (ACRIMe) GAO 12-708 audit, with last item relating to Integration Master Schedule for an agile development project.  Negotiated business and technical procedure changes in response to internal personally identifiable information (PII) security incidents.
defaultPosition.title: IT Specialist

positions.title: IT Specialist

positions.description: Chapter Director to network of independent travel agents.  Hosted information sharing sessions with partner companies and created a supportive community for agents who primarily worked remotely.
positions.title: Chapter Director, Northern Virginia

positions.description: Led management reporting and escalation activities to include providing guidance, collaboration and compliance information on the ICE OCIO Systems Lifecycle Methodology (SLM).  Developed executive reporting course and trained over 50 Information Technology (IT) Program/Project Managers (PMs) (GS14/15) including Program Management Offices (PMOs).  Coached Branch Directors and mentored SDD IT PMs in presentations, procedures and best practices. Established a Brown Bag Lunch Series including prioritization of topics, identifying speakers, communicating events and incorporating evaluation feedback.  Performed Risks and Issues Management on Level 1 (>$1B), 2 ($1B>X>$50M), and 3 (<$50M) programs by identifying areas of clarification for executive review. Managed 4 Sapient contracts and 11 resources including Associate through Manager, and subcontractors including profit/loss reporting. Nominated for two Sapient Core Value Awards in the areas of Relationships and Client-Focused Delivery.
positions.title: Manager, Program Management

positions.description: Managed on-shore/off-shore development team supporting 24x7 call centers in three time zones. Conduct weekly prioritization meetings with contact center, communicating timelines and work queue of existing projects and maintenance items. Review solutions monthly with business owners, training, end users, data warehouse team and quality assurance to validate product delivery is in alignment with requested changes including reporting impacts. Request For Proposal (RFP) creation, review, and analysis of vendor proposals for custom application development of a Customer Care portal as well as selection of an enterprise Knowledge Management System.
positions.title: Systems Development Project Manager

positions.description: Shared passion of cruise travel by helping others select their dream vacation.
positions.title: Owner

positions.description: Immersion trained in Ft. Lauderdale to become a cruise specialist.  Matched customers with vacations based on their preferences.
positions.title: Travel Agent

positions.description: Directed team at a wedding registry clicks-and-mortar client in documenting requirements for their back-end legacy system including payment processing, purchase ordering, point of sale, reporting, inventory management, fulfillment integration, gift registry and mail-order catalog focusing on delivering a high level of personalization and customer care while leveraging clientâs existing web technologies. Led team of 14 functional, development and creative resources to build an e-commerce site primarily coded with XML/XSL. Team built a reusable shopping cart, online catalog, and an administrative site allowing the client to control inventory. Created interfaces to allow for user-defined branding within the site. Third party applications included payment processing and customization of third party chat application. Managed 10-person quality assurance team for a hip-hop magazine looking to build online community, coordinating test cases, test results and issues log.
positions.title: Project Manager

positions.description: Analyzed and composed communications using legal requirements for outlining inventive nature of clientsâ applications.  Met in person and by phone to discuss technical and legal requirements of the patent application.  Utilized specialized patent examiner training, knowledge and research in the design of e-commerce applications and networks, user-interface software, and business-related uses of the Internet including telecommunications, healthcare, financial and smart card technologies to determine uniqueness of inventions.
positions.title: Patent Examiner

positions.description: Managed 12 programmers, proofreaders and quality assurance staff preparing financial compliance documents for filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC).
positions.title: Document Converstion Supervisor
